name: Recency Scoring Works
description: Given two episodes with identical quality scores, the more recent one should rank higher due to recency decay scoring.

setup.note: Cold start formula: 0.6 * quality + 0.4 * recency. Both episodes have Q=0.90, so recency is the tiebreaker.

recent.title: Introducing 4D Creation Open Beta: NPCs, 4D Worlds, and the Next Era of AI Gaming

older.title: Palmer Luckey on Hardware, Building, and the Next Frontiers of Defense Tech

pass_criteria.description: Both test episodes appear in top 10 cold start results
pass_criteria.check: recent_id in top_10_ids AND older_id in top_10_ids

pass_criteria.description: Recent episode has higher recency_score than older episode
Recent episode ranks higher (lower position number) than older episode

validation_method: Run cold start, find both episodes in results, compare recency_score and queue_position
notes: Using episodes with identical quality scores (C=3, I=3 â†’ Q=0.90) ensures recency is the only differentiating factor. With lambda=0.03, a 2-day age difference creates ~6% recency score difference.
research_note: The proposed 'Temporal Decay Hold' (Init Stability) test was considered but deemed redundant - it tests that high-quality old episodes remain visible, which is already ensured by the quality weight (30%) in the blended formula. If Test 01 (Cold Start Quality) and Test 03 (Quality Gates) pass with high-quality content surfacing, the stability property is implicitly satisfied.
